nodes.bodyText:
A question about dynamicFilter.getDomains().get().size() >= completedDynamicFilters.size():
May it happen that a dynamic filter corresponds to more than one probe-side column?
For example, when the query is:
SELECT * FROM left, right WHERE left.k1 = right.k AND left.k2 = right.k AND right.v = 0
In this case, is it OK to compare the size of TupleDomain<ColumnHandle> and Set<DynamicFilterId>?
In theory I think this could be the case. In practice unaliasing would prevent any multimaps. However, I don't think we should rely on that

Asking because I am not sure if the current implementation is thread-safe:
Do we assume that getCurrentPredicate is called from a single thread by the coordinator?

Asking because I am not sure if the current implementation is thread-safe:

Do you mean updating of currentDynamicFilter? Yes, it could be that two threads call getCurrentPredicate() and both update currentDynamicFilter. However, even if currentDynamicFilter was updated with less domains in such case, in the next call it will be updated again with more completed domains. It's best effort, but we always return up-to-date domains. Same thread should never see less completed domains in subsequent getCurrentPredicate() calls.
I will add a comment
Is there a guarantee that there will be another call? Or is it possible for that to be the last call and "get stuck" with a less complete domain?

Is there a guarantee that there will be another call?

@martint that's what io.prestosql.spi.connector.DynamicFilter#isComplete is for. Connector can check if the filter it will fetch will be final.
